title.narrative: Ridge to Reef (R2R) Project Preparation Grant (PPG)

description.narrative: This project preparation grant (PPG) is for development of a Full Sized Project (FSP) on “Implementing a Ridge-to-Reef approach to protecting biodiversity and ecosystem functions in Nauru (R2R Nauru)”.
The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Number of new partnership mechanisms with funding for sustainable management solutions of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste at national and/or sub-national level
Number of additional males benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Number of additional females benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Total number of additional people benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Number of men above 15 years of age who acquired new jobs through a UNDP-supported project on NRM, ecosystems services, chemicals and waste
Number of women above 15 years of age who acquired new jobs through a UNDP-supported project on NRM, ecosystems services, chemicals and waste
Total number of people above 15 years of age who acquired new jobs through a UNDP-supported project on NRM, ecosystems services, chemicals and waste
Implementing a Ridge-to-Reef approach to protecting biodiversity and ecosystem functions in Nauru (R2R Nauru)”.

This project is designed to strengthen the Legislative System in Nauru through capacity building of parliamentarians and the institution.

title.narrative: Nauru Legislative Strengthening Preparatory Assistance Project AWP and Concept Note

description.narrative: Nauru Legislative Strengthening Preparatory Assistance Project. he key focus of the Preparatory Assistance project, while providing a short-term assistance to the Parliament, is to conduct a Legislative Needs Assessment (LNA)
capital of a political entity
Elections - elections

1. % of MPs participating in induction training conducted in 2016. 2. # of recommendations made following standing committee meeting for review/draft Parliament Handbook. 3. Status of LNA Report providing recommendations for improvement in current parliament structure and procedures. 4. Status of HR Strategic Plan 5. % of equipment upgrade done following Technology Needs Analysis.

comment.narrative: 1. No induction training provided to MPs following elections in June 2013. 2. Absence or outdated Parliament Handbook to provide guidance to MPs on house procedures. 3. Outdated LNA report. 4. Limited professional development trainings and HR review for Secretariat Staff. 5. Technology system needs a review and some updating.
